intro: Pedicularis ramosissima, commonly known as the forked winter beauty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Due to its unique blooming time and striking appearance, it is a notable species in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
